column4: Guest37232: aptitude does the best job of resolving dependencies of all the package tools, in my experience, please define 'sucky'
sucky == no multithreading, still better for dependencies than cupt :)
for example, you could be installing package A while downloading package B if A does not depends on anything you dont have already
aptitude will first download (one file at a time) , then install (in a correct order) one package at a time
